summary:
I am a highly experienced professional in establishing business intelligence & analytic solutions, master data management & data quality initiatives and the technical integrations behind those. 

For me, establishing successful solutions that actually create value for organizations and individuals is the most satisfying. To achieve this I take full responsibility for everything I can do within my role to ensure customer satisfaction.  

I am successful in working with both complex large global companies as well as smaller local organizations because my combination of:
•	Consultative selling & stakeholder management skills.
•	Project management & hands-on technical skills.
•	Pro-active attitude towards customers & co-workers.
•	Self-starting mentality & make things happen approach.

I have been working in both external roles as internal positions. Regardless of being internal or external, my main goal is always to drive the adoption of solutions by:
•	Designing relevant solutions to support business value initiatives or solving hampering issues 
•	Translating solutions to required capabilities
•	Establishing required capabilities through technological features
•	Ensuring value creation by enabling the people and the organization to use the solutions

I was fortunate to work with complex global organizations across the world being part of on-site and virtual teams. The core main value I display in overcoming cultural differences and getting people involved to successfully work together is building trust. 

Becoming the trusted adviser is not only instrumental to overcoming cultural differences but also to gain support on all levels within the organization involved in making the solutions a success. I do this by:

•	Listening to internal & external stakeholders to gather individual requirements and understand their 
        personal motivation to tailor my message to the intended audience
•	Actively display & demo hand-on experience with relevant tools & methods to illustrate how 
        technological features address user needs on all levels
•	Applying consulting & communication skills to enable the organization and empower individuals 
•	Building, leading, managing and motivating teams & projects delivering concrete results

If you are interestred in establishing a value creating information management solution, feel free to contact me via LinkedIn, send an email to frans.tolen@gmail.com or give me a call on +31 6 126 00 185.

certifications.name: IBM Black Belt Social Media Analytics
IBM certified Component Based Modelling Professional
IBM certified Master Data Management Professional

projects.title: TEVA Pharmaceuticals, Global SAP roll-out KPI's and dashboards
projects.description:
Like PepsiCo, TEVA has also acquired a large number companies. Also they need to standardize on one single SAP instance. My role here was to define and standardize the Management Information reports and dashboards, by KPI standardization and strategy map.

Next to this I designed the organizational unit, including tasks and responsibilities, that was going to drive the implementation of the strategy map and related dashboards and delivered the 3-year roadmap to be followed.

Almost all work took place in Israel Tel Aviv, but as TEVA is really spread-out across the world I also had to work with parts of TEVA in Czech Republic, UK, US, Canada and Germany. Working with so many different cultures has been an enormous challenge, but also an extremely rewarding experience.

projects.title: Fonterra, New-Zealand, Designing future proof Consumer Demand Generation processes
projects.description:
Fonterra is the largest dairy company in Oceania.  They are based in Auckland, New-Zealand where I spend a considerable amount of time  for this project with them.

Fonterra is experiencing fierce competition from other companies. As one of the few companies I worked with, they understood consumer business was changing and visionary changes were needed in their consumer oriented processes.

So they started a really big project, completely redesigning all of their front- and back end processes but implementation should be done through industry leading software packages like SalesForce and SAP. 

My task here was to bring in latest developments and best practices in consumer marketing and customer loyalty. I did this through facilitating workshops, in which Fonterra people from all countries where Fonterra is present,  discussed their ideas and thoughts on the best practices I brought in.  

The end-result was a mutual defined and thus accepted process model, ready to be implemented through SAP and SalesForce.

projects.title: UCB, International Pharmaceutical preparing Business and IT services for Digital Channels and E-business
projects.description:
UCB is a big international pharmaceutical company based in Belgium.  At some point they understood that their current "IT services for Business" department was not capable of supporting the strategic choice to invest heavily in Multi-Channel customer management. 

Their solution was to completely redesign this department and my task was to introduce and define processes needed to move towards Multi-Channel customer management.    For this I firstly organized a number of plenary workshops to explore processes needed. Secondly detail the discovered processes with the expected process owners, thirdly translate processes into individual job descriptions and fourthly assess the current employees on this job-description to do gap-analysis and prepare a training plan.

As it should be, UCB took full responsibility to develop and execute a change management roadmap crafting their way forward. During the implementation of their roadmap I was only engaged in the advisory board  to coach them on their journey.

projects.title: PepsiCo Data-to-Information foundation projects
projects.description:
PepsiCo had taken  over a large number of companies, but hereby inherited also the IT legacy of those companies. To solve this, they were standardizing all  those companies on a new SAP template. My job was to define and organize the Data-to-Information process stream  and  create a harmonized KPI-framework across the other process domains. 

The project took place mostly in Barcelona, but as part of the project, I have also been to PepsiCo Mexico to define the global  Chief Data Officer (CDO) position  including tasks and responsibilities.

After that I did a  master- and metadata project that was necessary to standardize master data management processes and to create a meta-data data dictionary.

The last project I did with them was in Geneva and London and defined the overall strategy map, KPI-trees and data source systems to initialize building their Global Performance Management   system.

projects.title: Design a Lights-Out Marketing factory for Rabobank Netherlands
projects.description:
Rabobank was still on some old technology which hampered their ambition to grow into Multichannel Individual Event Based Marketing. The technical components they needed were a  rules engine, capable of selecting leads from their marketing database,  a campaign manager applying those rules and a database in which they could track the individual customer dialogs to understand how customers responded to their marketing efforts and why.

 In this project I designed the solution architecture, introduced a method to define the customer dialogs and communication framework, leading to the requirements to be supported by the rules engine and the campaign manager.

profile_positions.description:
Within Jitterbit I design and sell iPaaS Integration solutions leveraging dedicated connectors and API’s. I am thereby not limited to solely technical feasibility, but also take care for customer enablement by defining and delivering integration programs addressing all levels of management. 

I drive and manage the technical sales-cycle by delivering initial product evaluations, product demonstration and addressing technical pain points.  

Achievements: 
	Delivered technical proof to close deals and grow ACV of new contracts. 
	Ensured yearly extensions and upgrades with existing customers.
	Successfully enabled partners positioning, selling and implementing Jitterbit’s iPaaS platform.
profile_positions.title: Senior Principal Solutions Engineer EMEA

profile_positions.description:
Qlik was moving from their on-premise product into a cloud-based solution. This required advisory- and business consulting skills to add to their current selling capabilities to ensure customer loyalty and satisfaction leading to yearly extensions and renewing subscriptions. 

Achievements: 
	Successfully growed pipeline and extending ACV of new contracts. 
	Successfully upgraded customers to platform licenses, increasing revenue and customer loyalty.
	Successfully enabled partners positioning, selling and implementing Qlik.
	Turned around a number of troubled projects to restore customer satisfaction
	Managed team of 3 direct reports
profile_positions.title: Principal Consultant Qlik Advisory EMEA

profile_positions.description:
In this role I worked with local sales- and delivery teams creating pipeline and enable solution delivery for IBM’s latest product portfolio for Smarter Consumer imperatives.

Next to this, I worked in large scale digital transformation engagements with leading customers across the world to act as the IBM counterpart for strategic management, global process owners and Chief Data Officers in the Data-to-Information process domain.

Achievements: 
	Successfully build pipeline with local account teams in EMEA.
	Assisted local sales engagements for the latest innovative IBM solutions, contributing to revenue.
	Delivered global digital transformation projects for customer analytics, data quality and Master data Management
	Managed team of 15 direct reports
profile_positions.title: Principal Consultant Strategy, Change & Analytics

profile_positions.description:
In this role I executed cross brand assignments at customer sites implementing Business Intelligence solutions, Analytical Solutions, Customer Marketing Solutions, Data Quality assessments and Master Data Management solutions. 

Next to delivering positive project results and achieving utilizations targets, also responsible for achieving sales target by managing and delivering complex sales cycles.

Achievements IBM Global Business Services:
	Successfully delivered cross brand solution & business architectures at a variety of clients. 
	Managed complex sales cycles inclusive the delivery of solution proposals, SOW´s, implementation plans and risk assessments. 
	People manager of around 20 people, hereby consistently delivering utilization targets.
profile_positions.title: Senior Managing Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for new business and for cross- and up selling of the business intelligence and data-management platform components, covering as well the business side as technical demonstrations.

In these assignments I was acting as Subject Matter Expert in Data-Warehouse solutions, Business Intelligence solutions, Master data Management, Data Quality and Integration solutions. 

Hereby excelled in translating customer’s business drivers into demonstrating required capabilities as delivered by the Information Builders platform. 

Achievements: 
	Successfully participated in converting business opportunities to new licenses.  
	Upgraded customers into platform licenses, hereby increasing revenue and customer loyalty.
